Indexing Test Document

Chapter 1: Introduction to Programming

Programming is the art of creating software applications.

Python is a popular programming language.

Variables store data in memory.

Chapter 2: Data Structures

Arrays are fundamental data structures.

Python uses lists instead of traditional arrays.

Dictionaries provide key-value storage.

Chapter 3: Algorithms

Algorithms solve computational problems efficiently.

Big O notation describes algorithm complexity.

Recursive algorithms call themselves.

Chapter 4: Object-Oriented Programming

Classes define object blueprints.

Polymorphism enables flexible code design.

Encapsulation hides implementation details.

Conclusion

Following best practices leads to maintainable code.
